text: Fulfilling Britain’s great potential
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This general election is in many ways even more important than the last.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since May 1997 we have laid the foundations of a Britain whose economy is stronger, where investment is now pouring into public services, where social division is being slowly healed and where influence abroad is being regained.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But these are only the foundations of larger change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now is the chance to build the future properly, to make the second term the basis for a radical programme of British renewal: to keep a firm grip on inflation, with low interest rates and the public finances sound, and then build the dynamic and productive economy of the future;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: to keep investment coming into public services and then making the reforms so we use the money well;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: to refashion the welfare state on the basis of rights and responsibilities, with people helped to help themselves, not just given handouts;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: to ensure all families are safe in their communities by tackling crime and its causes;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: and to give Britain back its leadership role in the world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We need the second term to do all this.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That is the choice: to make progress or to dismantle the foundations laid.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And with the state of today’s Conservatives, the choice is stark.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This choice will decide whether more people will be able to realise their aspirations for themselves and their children – to be able to rely on a stable economy where hard work is rewarded by rising living standards, to receive world-class education and healthcare, to enjoy a dignified old age, to feel safe and secure in a strong community, and to be proud to be British.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Or whether we will be held back by the traditional British malaise of restricting life’s great opportunities and blessings to a minority.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There is much still to be done, but we have come a long way in four years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain stands more prosperous, more equal, more respected.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our country is on a new course.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: My passion is to continue the modernisation of Britain in favour of hard-working families, so that all our children, wherever they live, whatever their background, have an equal chance to benefit from the opportunities our country has to offer and to share in its wealth.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The challenge for Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: I am honoured to be Prime Minister.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And I have a confident belief in our country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are not boastful.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we have real strengths.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Great people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Strong values.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A proud history.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The British people achieved magnificent things in the 20th century.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But for too long, our strengths have been undermined by weaknesses of elitism and snobbery, vested interests and social division, complacency bred by harking back to the past.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We achieved spurts of economic growth, but inflation would then get out of control.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our welfare state was founded to offer security, but its progress was stalled.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We reached out to Europe, then drew back to become semi-detached.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is as if a glass ceiling has stopped us fulfilling our potential.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In the 21st century, we have the opportunity to break through that glass ceiling, because our historic strengths match the demands of the modern world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We can use our openness and entrepreneurial flair to become a global centre in the knowledge economy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We can use our sense of fair play and mutual responsibility to be a strong, dynamic, multiracial society held together by strong values.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We can use our historic and geographical position to link Europe and America, and help the developing world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The key to tapping our strengths, to breaking through this glass ceiling, is contained in a simple but hard-to-achieve idea, set out at the heart of our party’s constitution: the determination to put power, wealth and opportunity in the hands of the many, not the few.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: I know as well as anyone that we have just begun; millions of hard-working families want, need and deserve more.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That means more change in a second term, not less – to extend opportunity for all.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We reject the quiet life.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We must secure a mandate for change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Ten goals for 2010:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Long-term economic stability.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Rising living standards for all.

text: •Expanded higher education as we raise standards in secondary schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • A healthier nation with fast treatment, free at the point of use.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: •Full employment in every region.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Opportunity for all children, security for all pensioners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • A modern criminal justice system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • British ideas leading a reformed and enlarged Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Shifting the odds for hard-working families.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997 we promised a start, not a revolution.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We made five specific five-year pledges.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Three have been completed early; all will be completed within five years, as we promised.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Each pledge is matched by further achievement: the lowest inflation and unemployment for a generation; one million new jobs; over 17,000 extra nurses, the best primary school test results ever and, as the British Crime Survey shows, crime is down by ten per cent.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We also offered a ten-point contract to the British people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The results are at the back of this manifesto.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Not everything has gone right – it never does.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we are getting there, easing burdens and extending opportunities, by choice not chance.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Economic instability wrecks the lives of hard-working families.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So we chose to put the public finances right.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It meant tough decisions that were opposed by the Conservatives.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But today the economy is stable and growing, and interest rates are nearly half the level they averaged under the Conservatives.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Unemployment steals dignity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So we chose to introduce a windfall tax on the excess profits of the privatised utilities and to use the money to help unemployed people back to work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That was opposed by the Conservatives, who are now pledged to abolish the New Deal.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But today, youth unemployment is at its lowest level since 1975 and longterm unemployment at its lowest level since 1978.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Poor education is a cruel injustice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So we chose to introduce a new system for teaching the basics in primary schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We met opposition, and the Conservatives want to roll back our programmes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But today, primary schools are achieving their best results ever.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A run-down health service causes insecurity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So we chose to reform the NHS, and inject new money.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Waiting lists and times are now down and falling, and the number of nurses and doctors is now rising.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Poverty denies basic rights.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So we chose to reform the welfare state to channel extra money to the poorest pensioners and poorest children.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Today, single pensioners can look forward to a minimum income of £100 a week and pensioner couples £154, and over one million children have been taken out of poverty.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The centralisation of power only helps the powerful.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So we chose to break the suffocating centralisation of British government.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The UK has been strengthened.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Today, it is the Conservatives who threaten the stability of the UK with their proposals for two classes of MP.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our Scottish and Welsh manifestos, alongside this one, set out our vision for continued partnership.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Isolation from Europe does not help anyone.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So we chose to engage constructively in Europe, not to shout abuse from the sidelines.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Today, Europe is moving in a direction that is good for Britain and good for Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In policy for aid, development and international debt relief, we have led the way.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Of course, there are still big problems, but we are better off, better educated, better governed, better respected abroad.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There has been another change too – a change of priorities and values.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We learnt in the 1980s that looking after number one was not enough; that without opportunity, responsibility was weak; that an unfair society was a less prosperous one.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The philosophy was wrong – it hurt millions of families and left our country with lasting problems.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have shown we are a reformed party, competent to govern.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now we offer more.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: More change, and more rewards for Britain’s hard-working families: more prosperity, more opportunities, more security.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Ambitions for Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Stretching the family budget, finding time for children as well as work, holding on to mutual respect, staying healthy when there can be danger even in the air we breathe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: These are daily worries that people face.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: They are my concerns too.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But, while there is always a market for people who say we are doomed, that all new ideas are bad ideas even as things improve, that we might as well curl up with our prejudices and shut the door on the world, I am an optimist.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour is ambitious for Britain’s future and is ready to lead.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: First, we will sustain economic stability and build deeper prosperity that reaches every region of the country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Skills, infrastructure, the technological revolution – all are vital to raise British living standards faster.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will put as much energy into helping the seven million adults without basic skills as we did when tackling long-term unemployment through the New Deal.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Second, we seek to achieve a renaissance of status and quality for public services and their staff.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on our success in primary schools to overhaul secondary schools;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: we will invest new resources and empower doctors and nurses to transform health services;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: and we will seek to extend the very best in culture and sport to all.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Third, we seek to modernise the welfare state.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The benefits system will be restructured around work; support for children and families through the tax and benefits system will be transformed; cash and services for pensioners will be radically improved.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Fourth, we will strengthen our communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will reform the criminal justice system at every level so that criminals are caught, punished and rehabilitated.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And because we know that without tackling the causes of crime we will never tackle crime, we will empower local communities by combining resources with responsibility.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Fifth, we will turn our inner confidence to strength abroad, in Europe and beyond, to tackle global problems
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: – above all, environmental degradation and the shame of global poverty.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will engage fully in Europe, help enlarge the European Union and make it more effective, and insist that the British people have the final say on any proposal to join the Euro.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: These ambitions are summarised in ten goals for 2010.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: They will never be achieved by government alone.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We know it is people who ultimately change the country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our partnership with the voluntary sector has steadily strengthened since 1997, as we learn from its diversity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We work with the private sector, drawing on its vitality.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Countries only prosper on the basis of partnership – between government, employers and their employees, and the voluntary sector.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: What Britain needs is an active, enabling state, not a nanny state, doing things with people not to them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So, while the Conservatives will spend most of this election telling you what their government cannot do, this manifesto sets out what our government can do.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We know the power and value of markets, but we also know their limits.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now is the time to renew our civic and social institutions to deliver improvements in education, health, safety, transport and the environment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Fighting for values, not just for election victory.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Conservatives always look back.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In economic policy they promise to repeat the mistakes of the 1980s – unaffordable tax cuts and spending cuts, followed by ballooning deficits, rising interest rates and the old cycle of boom and bust.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In social policy their renewed commitment to cuts and privatisation and to withdrawing the support helping to heal social division, is just a throwback to the 1980s.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In foreign policy they risk not just isolation but exit from the EU.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Jobs, trade, investment depend on our membership of the European Union.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Conservative policy of opposing the enlargement of Europe in the Nice Treaty and their pledge to renegotiate the terms of Britain’s EU membership is dangerous and ill thought-out.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Standing up for Britain means fighting for Britain’s interests in Europe, not leaving Europe – which threatens our national interest.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So the choice Britain faces today is starker than in 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Conservatives have swung further to the right.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And, in government, Labour’s agenda has become increasingly bold and ambitious.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For many years, the Conservatives claimed to offer economic strength while Labour dominated social issues.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Many people found their head telling them to vote Tory, and their heart telling them to vote Labour.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Today, head and heart are coming together.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour is proving that it is only by using the talents of all that we get a healthy economy, and that it is only by giving a stake to all that we are a healthy society.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have made our choice: stability not boom and bust; investment not cuts; engagement not isolationism; the many, not the few.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A lot done and a lot more to do with new Labour – or a lot for you to lose under the Conservatives.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: I deeply believe that, for Britain, the best is still to come.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So I ask you to continue on this journey with us.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Together we can achieve so much more.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Prime Minister and Leader of the Labour Party
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Investment and reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Public services: investment and reform Renewal of our public services is at the centre of new Labour’s manifesto.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A single aim drives our policy programme: to liberate people’s potential, by spreading power, wealth and opportunity more widely, breaking down the barriers that hold people back.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But this is only possible on the continued foundation of economic stability: mortgages as low as possible, low inflation and sound public finances.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The manifesto is comprehensive.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Here we set out some of the key measures for investment and reform that we believe give us a historic opportunity to modernise our schools, NHS, criminal justice system and welfare state.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Renewing public services: substantial investment
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour believes that Britain needs investment in schools and hospitals, not reckless tax cuts.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Before 1997 we promised and kept to two tough years on spending to get the public finances in shape.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now, consistent with meeting our fiscal rules, we promise substantial rises for key public services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: To help deliver our plans, our ten-year goal is the renewal of local government.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will now:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - increase education spending by more than five per cent in real terms each year for the next three years as we increase the share of national income for education in the next Parliament.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - increase health spending by an average of six per cent in real terms each year for the next three years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - increase spending on our police – an extra £1.6 billion a year by 2003/04.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - increase spending on transport by 20 per cent for the next three years, on our way to a £180 billion investment of public and private money for transport over the next ten years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - use a £400 million reward fund for local government in return for signing up to clear targets to improve local services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Renewing public services: more frontline staff
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour believes in renewing a public service ethic by giving frontline staff new freedoms to respond to public needs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For public services to be renewed, we will need more staff, properly rewarded.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is these frontline staff, operating in new ways, who will drive up standards in our key public services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will decentralise power to make that possible.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will now deliver:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - 20,000 more nurses who will be given new enhanced roles and more power for matrons and ward sisters with control over budgets.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - 10,000 more doctors, and access to a £500 million Performance Fund to spend on new patient services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - 10,000 more teachers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Invest in further rapid promotion and rewards for classroom excellence, more classroom assistants and help with housing costs in high-cost areas.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - 6,000 extra police recruits, raising police numbers to their highest ever level, with strong local leadership and proper rewards for those on the frontline.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Economic stability: the foundation
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour believes that a stable economy is the platform for rising living standards and opportunity for all.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goals are for long-term economic stability and faster productivity growth than our main competitors.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will now:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - deliver economic stability with mortgages as low as possible, low inflation and sound public finances.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - reform further education, and help 750,000 adults achieve basic skills
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - expand the Children’s Tax Credit to offer up to £1,000 per year for parents of newborn children.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - create a new Child Trust Fund for every child at birth.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - increase the minimum wage to £4.20.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - not raise the basic or top rate of income tax and extend the 10p band.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - strengthen regional economies with venture capital funds and new powers for reformed Regional Development Agencies.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - develop the Small Business Service and cut red tape.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - give British people the final say in any referendum on the single currency.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Renewing public services: education reform
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour believes that schools need a step change in reform to make quality education open to all.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We plan a radical improvement in secondary schools, building on our success in primary schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our aim is to develop fully the talents of each child.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goal is 50 per cent of young adults entering higher education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will now:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - ensure every secondary school develops a distinctive mission including the expansion of specialist schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - diversify state schools with new City Academies and more church schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - direct more money to headteachers, more freedom for successful schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - reform provision for 11- to 14-year-olds to ensure higher standards in English, maths, science and information technology.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - introduce new vocational options from 14 onwards, with expanded apprenticeship opportunities
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - ensure primary schools offer more chance to learn languages, music and sport, as well as higher standards in the basics.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - provide a good-quality nursery place for every three-year-old.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Renewing public services: NHS reform
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour believes that the NHS needs radical reform to fulfil its founding principle of quality treatment based on need, not ability to pay.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The NHS needs radical reform if it is to be designed around the needs of patients.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Investment is vital but not enough.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s ten-year goal is a maximum waiting time of three months as we become a healthier nation with fast, high-quality treatment, free at the point of use.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will now:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - decentralise power to give local Primary Care Trusts control of 75 per cent of NHS funding, and cut by two thirds the number of health authorities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - reform the appointments system so that by the end of 2005 every hospital appointment is booked for the convenience of the patient.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - cut maximum waiting times by the end of 2005 for outpatient appointments from six months to three months and inpatients, from 18 to six months.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - work with the private sector to use spare capacity, where it makes sense, for NHS patients.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - create a new type of hospital – specially built surgical units, managed by the NHS or the private sector – to guarantee shorter waiting times
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - allow successful NHS hospitals to take over failing ones.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Renewing public services: welfare reform
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour believes that rights and responsibilities should be at the centre of reform of the welfare state– to lift children and pensioners out of poverty, and help parents balance work and family.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to reform the tax and benefit system to reward work, not irresponsibility.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goals are to achieve full employment in every region, to halve child poverty and tackle pensioner poverty.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will now:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - create an integrated Child Credit of cash support for children, built on the foundation of universal child benefit.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - establish a new Pension Credit for lower- and middle-income pensioners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - establish a new ‘Employment First’ interview for people entering the welfare system, and integrate the Benefits Agency and Employment Service through major reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - extend and increase paid maternity leave to £100 each week for six months.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - introduce paid paternity leave.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - expand childcare places to provide for 1.6 million children.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Renewing public services: criminal justice reform
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour believes that crime can only be cut by dealing with the causes of crime as well as being tough on criminals.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We plan the most comprehensive reform of the criminal justice system since the war – to catch, convict, punish and rehabilitate more of the 100,000 persistent offenders.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goal is a modernised criminal justice system with the burglary rate halved.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will now:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - overhaul sentencing so that persistent offending results in more severe punishment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - reform custodial sentences so that every offender gets punishment and rehabilitation designed to minimise reoffending.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - reform rules of evidence to simplify trials and bring the guilty to justice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - introduce specialist, late-sitting and review courts to reflect crime patterns and properly monitor offenders.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - establish a new Criminal Assets Recovery Agency to seize assets of crime barons and a register of dealers to tackle drugs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - introduce a victims bill of rights providing legal rights to compensation, support and information.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 1. Prosperity for all
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goals:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Fiscal rules consistently met, low inflation and interest rates as low as possible, as we deliver long-term economic stability.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Faster productivity growth than our main competitors, as we achieve rising living standards for all.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our next steps:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Basic skills for 750,000 people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Venture capital funds in every region.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - £180 billion investment in transport, with 25 local rail and tram schemes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Raise the minimum wage to £4.20.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - £1,000 tax cut – the Children’s Tax Credit – for parents of newborn Children.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s purpose is to help every family, not just a few, to raise their living standards and plan ahead with security.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have a ten-year vision: higher living standards, affordable mortgages and fairer taxes combined with much greater investment in vital public services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Economic stability is the foundation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We know the price of boom and bust – it was paid in the 1980s and 1990s by millions of hard-working families.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our reforms since 1997 have helped cut interest rates to nearly half the average under the Conservatives, saving mortgage payers on average £1,200 a year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2010, we want Britain to break away from the decades of boom and bust, as we stick to clear rules for spending and borrowing.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will take no risks with economic policy, make no compromise on fiscal responsibility.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Stability comes first.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But stability is not enough.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We need to produce more, better and to a higher value to raise our earning power and to meet our ten-year goal of faster productivity growth than our main competitors.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We must make Britain the best place to do business in Europe – a dynamic economy, founded on skills and knowledge, developing the talent of all our people, and contributing to sustainable development.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That means investment by private and public sectors in infrastructure and skills, and the right competitive framework to support enterprise, small and large, manufacturing and services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Every extra trained, employed worker contributes to a fairer society, as well as a more prosperous one.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With social failure, from school drop-outs to crime, comes economic failure.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Fairness and enterprise go together.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is up to government to do everything it can to help ensure that no individual and no community is left behind.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The fundamentals – Better off with Labour
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The foundation of opportunity and prosperity is economic stability.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We know the risks of promises that cannot be paid for: the Conservatives led Britain into two deep recessions, double-digit inflation, record unemployment, 15 per cent interest rates and a doubling of the national debt.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Choice, not chance, has turned things round.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Independence for the Bank of England and longterm fiscal rules have given the UK the most stable and transparent economic framework in Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain now has the best combination of low interest rates, low inflation and low unemployment since the 1960s.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are saving nearly £9 billion this year from debt and unemployment, so 84p of every extra pound of public spending goes on national priorities, compared to 58p under the Conservatives.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So we will pursue a balanced approach on the economy with stability the foundation, more investment not less and, as affordable, targeted tax cuts on our priorities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our aim is to put more wealth in the hands of more people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That is why we will keep mortgage rates as low as possible, ensure competition keeps down household bills, support savings and share ownership, and create a new Child Trust Fund for every child at birth to invest for when they reach adulthood.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There are no guarantees in an integrated world economy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we showed during the Asian economic crisis how to steer a course of stability in turbulent times.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to work at international level to minimise global economic turbulence, and to protect Britain if it occurs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Tax and spending.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Fiscal responsibility and monetary stability are the foundation of our future plans.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour’s inflation target is 2.5 per cent.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to meet our fiscal rules: over the economic cycle we will borrow only to invest, and keep net debt at a stable and prudent level.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are pledged to raise health and education spending for the next three years at twice the rate of the Conservative years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will double net public investment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And we are on track to save £1 billion in the costs of government purchasing by 2003.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Tax policy will be governed by the health of the public finances, the requirement for public investment, and the needs of families, business and the environment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have rewarded work through the new 10p starting rate of tax and the Working Families Tax Credit.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The basic rate of tax has been cut to 22p.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will support families through the new Children’s Tax Credit, set at up to £1,000 a year for new parents – the first recognition of the costs of children in the tax system for 20 years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: On average, UK households have benefited by £590 a year from personal tax and benefit measures introduced since 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: During this Parliament, living standards have risen by ten per cent for a single earner family on average earnings.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: To help those who work and save, we will extend the 10p tax band.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to tackle tax avoidance.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will not raise the basic or top rates of income tax in the next Parliament.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We renew our pledge not to extend VAT to food, children’s clothes, books, newspapers and public transport fares.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour rewards work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour believes that if you work hard you should be able to support a family.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will guarantee a minimum family income of £225 for a 35-hour week;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: in the next Parliament, an Employment Tax Credit will reward the work of people on low incomes, whether or not they have children (see ‘A modern welfare state’).
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The first-ever National Minimum Wage for Britain, bitterly opposed at every stage by the Conservatives, has been a success in our first term.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It fulfils, after 100 years, a founding ambition of the Labour Party.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Up to 1.5 million people, the majority of them women, have been helped; jobs have not been lost.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Low Pay Commission, which we will make permanent, has made clear recommendations for the future.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour will raise the minimum wage to £4.10 this October, and is committed, subject to economic conditions, to raising it to £4. 0 in October 2002.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour rewards saving.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Nine million people invested in ISAs in their first year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: To encourage more saving, we will maintain the £7,000 contribution limit for the next Parliament.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will help pensioners: the Pension Credit will match private saving with government funds, and pensioners will no longer be penalised because of their thrift (See ‘A modern welfare state’).
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: To boost the savings habit, we will create a new Savings Gateway for people on lower incomes where their savings will be matched by the government.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The productivity challenge – Staying better off
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: To raise living standards, our ambition is to raise our productivity faster than our competitors and to ensure our goods and services are competitive in world markets.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour has four priorities:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 1. Investment in skills and innovation
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Skills:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are passionate about giving every child the chance of a decent education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we are equally determined to offer learning opportunities to adults.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ambition is for everyone to have the opportunity to train, in a partnership of employers, employees and government, each giving time and/or money to raise standards of skills in the UK.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our first priority is to help the estimated seven million adults who lack basic literacy and numeracy skills, with 750,000 people achieving basic skill levels by 2004.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • ensure that job seekers get the benefit of a basic skills test, as well as incentives and obligations to take courses to tackle literacy and/or numeracy problems
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • set up a network of 6,000 IT learning centres around the country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • extend Individual Learning Accounts, which have already been opened by over a million people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • dramatically improve the quality and quantity of prison education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • tackle the financial barriers that prevent adults studying in further education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Basic skills are the start; updating skills is relevant for all of us.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have created the Learning and Skills Council for all post-school learning outside higher education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Further education colleges have a critical role to play in the future.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will encourage dedicated colleges for under-19s and specialist adult provision to meet local skills needs, with half of all colleges to be recognised as centres of vocational excellence by 2003- 04.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The world’s first University for Industry now offers over 400 skills courses.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For skill shortages in information technology, we will open two Technology Institutes in every region to meet the rising demand for high-level technical skills.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We need a step-change in workplace learning, particularly in small and medium-sized firms.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are determined to develop a three-way partnership to bring this about.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Current arrangements have secured increased participation, but not enough.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Unions and employers have a key role – but we also need to motivate individual employees.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Where both sides of industry in a sector agree, we will help set up a statutory framework for training.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will boost the efforts of trade unions to raise skill levels by giving statutory backing to union learning representatives and supporting the Union Learning Fund.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Government has a wide-ranging role to play and is seeking to develop a training tax credit.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will look to business and unions to come forward with proposals on how they can contribute to meeting the nation’s training goals.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Everyone has a responsibility to help deliver a high-skill, high-productivity economy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Innovation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Science and technology are the basis of new products and industries, both vital to productivity growth.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since 1997 extra investment of £1.5 billion over three years has given science a fresh start, and a new stream of university funding has helped create new links between scientific breakthroughs and new products.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we need to invest more to be at the cutting edge of science – in biotechnology and genome research.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We propose an R&D tax credit to promote business investment in research.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work for a European patent system by the end of this year to simplify the process of bringing ideas to market.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The £235 billion a year, and growing, global market for green technology gives real opportunity to British industry to benefit from a shift to low carbon technologies.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to encourage the best scientists to work in the UK, as well as making the most of our science base in universities (see ‘Worldclass public services’).
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 2. Supporting British business.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Government cannot make a business successful.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But government must create the right framework to help business achieve healthy long-term growth.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since 1997, corporation tax rates have been cut to their lowest levels ever.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Companies no longer face a perverse incentive to pay out dividends rather than invest for the future.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Reform of capital gains tax has given the entrepreneur or investor new incentives for investment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We support vital investment through the tax system – with allowances for high tech as well as small business investment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Myners report has identified weaknesses in our venture capital market, undermining longterm investment and economic dynamism.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will act on its recommendations, including the abolition of the minimum funding requirement and reforms to pension fund management, and review progress in two 408years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: When people have worked hard, they want their money to go as far as possible.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Competition policy has already helped cut cash-machine charges and new car prices.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will extend our fair and robust competition regime by giving more independence to the competition authorities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will toughen the laws on rogue traders, unfair terms in contracts, and loan sharks.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In the labour market, minimum standards for people at work offer dignity and self-esteem.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Regulation should be introduced, where it is necessary, in a light-touch way.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will cut back the red tape associated with regulation, examine opportunities to put time limits on regulations, deregulate by secondary legislation, and offer help to small firms.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Over 150,000 small businesses have been set up since 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will develop the Small Business Service as an advocate for small business in government and a servant of small businesses around the country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to reforming the tax treatment of small business, including VAT, and to seeking a reduction in payroll burdens.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Small business will also benefit from extending the 10p tax band.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will reform the bankruptcy laws to ensure second chances for people who go bankrupt through no fault of their own, and provide funds for new start-ups.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also promote the development of entrepreneurship in the school curriculum.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will modernise company law to promote transparency, reduce burdens on small business and promote long-term economic success.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We welcome the recommendations of the Co-operative Commission, which also covered the significant mutual sector, and will examine them with a view to strengthening these important parts of our economy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 3. Modernising our infrastructure for the information age – Digital nation
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The infrastructure of the future includes fast, efficient and affordable communication – telecommunications, the internet and broadcasting.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That requires the best competitive environment, effective regulation and continued public and private investment in the technologies of the future.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A ‘digital divide’ would hurt business as well as individuals: universal access is vital to effective markets.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will put all government services on-line by 2005, to improve access to services and spur business on-line.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work to ensure that broadband, which allows fast internet access, is accessible in all parts of the country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: English is the language of the internet.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have the best TV in the world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The next challenge is to open up the learning opportunities and enjoyment offered by digital TV and the internet to every household.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to making the switchover from analogue to digital signals as soon as conditions for access and cost have been met.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The governance of this fast-changing industry is out of date.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will merge the five separate regulators into one, to create the world’s most competitive and advanced regulatory system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We believe in the value and necessity of public service broadcasting and have committed to major funding increases for the BBC and to supporting a publicly owned Channel 4 and S4C.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Ofcom will ensure a level playing field, benefiting consumers in terms of choice, price and quality, in particular through promoting competition.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Transport.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A strong economy needs good transport.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Yet our inheritance was massive under-investment, with British Rail broken into over a hundred privatised pieces, and bus services in decline.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s priority is to improve and expand railway and road travel.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year Transport Plan, supported by all the key players, matches large resources with major reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: £180 billion of investment, split between railways, roads and local transport and delivered in partnership with the private sector, offers real hope to motorists and passengers alike.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Rail: Passenger numbers have risen by 17 per cent since 1997, and freight increased by 22 per cent.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But recent crises have proved the need for urgent investment and strong regulation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With Labour, £60 billion will be spent on upgrading the rail network, with the majority of rolling stock replaced.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Five hundred new carriages are already in use, another 3,000 ordered.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We plan to expand capacity to boost passenger levels by 50 per cent, and freight by more.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Safer train protection systems are now being installed and will be extended following Lord Cullen’s report into rail safety.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Strategic Rail Authority (SRA) has been set up to provide strong, strategic direction.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Train companies will get longer franchises in return for higher investment and improved services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The SRA will lead the expansion of the network, using public-private partnerships (PPPs).
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Railtrack is being reformed to focus on the operation of existing track and signalling.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Rail Regulator, with strengthened powers, will ensure the delivery of higher standards, increased safety and increased investment by the company.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: London will benefit from new trains and reduced overcrowding on its commuter services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We support plans to build a new East-West Cross-rail tunnel and to extend the East London Line.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have pledged increased, long-term investment in the Tube to underpin a publicprivate partnership to upgrade Tube infrastructure, with operations remaining in the public sector.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our agreement with the London Mayor and Transport Commissioner offers the best chance in a generation to upgrade the Tube.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Supertrams will transform transport in our big cities, with 25 new light rail or tram schemes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Services have been introduced or expanded in Manchester, Birmingham, Croydon, Sheffield, Nottingham, Tyne and Wear with plans under way for supertrams in Leeds, Portsmouth and Bristol.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Roads: The Transport Plan allocates £60 billion to road improvement.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Motorways will be upgraded; a hundred new bypasses will reduce accidents and pollution.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But environmentally damaging road schemes have been scrapped; all new roads must now be strictly appraised for maximum benefits and minimum environmental damage.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our trunk roads are the safest in Europe and we aim to reduce serious road casualties by a further 40 per cent over ten years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: £8.4 billion is now being invested in local authority schemes in England.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have given local authorities the freedom to choose to use charges to reduce traffic – but we insist they put the money into better transport services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New road safety schemes will mean more school bus services and traffic-free Home Zones where people can walk safely, and children play without danger, to help cut the number of child road deaths and serious injuries by 50 per cent by 2010.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Road tax is being cut on smaller, cleaner cars and duty reduced on greener fuels.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Tax incentives are creating a cleaner lorry fleet while the road haulage industry will benefit from steep reductions in Vehicle Excise Duty to among the lowest in Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also ensure that hauliers from overseas pay their fair share towards the cost of our roads.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Smarter driving will be encouraged by new highway communications technology.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are also working with the motor industry on safer, more fuel-efficient vehicles.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Buses: are vital to local journeys.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With Labour, 25,000 new buses are already in operation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2006, almost the whole national bus fleet will be renewed.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Lower concessionary fares have been introduced for over five million older and disabled travellers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Park and ride schemes are increasing, and over 100 towns now have bus services linked to train stations, with cut-price fares.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Bus partnerships between local authorities and private bus companies will improve passenger numbers and service quality.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Nationally we will work to improve inter-city coach services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Integrated transport
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Good transport systems offer choice across transport modes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Transport Direct – a phone and internet system designed to plan journeys and sell tickets – will put transport services at people’s fingertips.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Walking and cycling will be encouraged in thousands of local transport schemes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Inland waterways are being revitalised and we will take forward the recommendations of the enquiry into the Marchioness disaster.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: International links are also vital.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Plans for aviation and airports over the next 30 years will be produced next year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Merchant ships are returning to the British flag.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will complete the high-speed Channel Tunnel Rail Link.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Major national infrastructure projects, such as Heathrow Terminal 5, raise vital issues.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to modernise the planning system and introduce new fast-track procedures for major projects of national significance.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Post Office and postal services
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to high-quality, universal postal services, and a dynamic Post Office which can thrive in a world of technological change and increased competitive pressure.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is working with the banks to offer a new universal banking service.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This will allow all benefit and pension recipients to receive their payments, at no charge, in full at the post office after the switch to Automated Credit Transfer in 2003.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We also intend the local post office to become an invaluable resource for access to government information.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There will be increased incentives for people to take over and modernise post offices.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Business customers, representing by far the majority of the Post Office’s turnover, want a full range of express, parcels and logistics services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have given the Post Office greater commercial freedom in the public sector.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It needs to be able to gain an advantage in the new postal market and become a leading force in domestic and international postal services through alliances and joint ventures.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want to help the Post Office keep up with the best in a fast-changing market.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Energy
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to a secure, diverse and sustainable supply of energy at competitive prices.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have brought full competition to the gas and electricity markets.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Coal and nuclear energy currently play import roles in ensuring diversity in our sources of electricity generation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are putting an obligation on electricity companies to deliver ten per cent of the UK’s electricity from renewable sources by 2010, with a doubling of combined heat and power.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will consider setting further targets for renewables, with particular focus on offshore wind, solar and biomass technologies, supported by a £100 million fund.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It will back up the Climate Change Levy, which includes agreements to improve efficiency in energy-intensive sectors, and the new Carbon Trust, which will recycle £100 million to accelerate the take-up of cost-effective, low-carbon technologies.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will support research into clean coal technology and investigate its commercial possibilities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will double the expenditure on energy efficiency.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Fuel poverty blights lives: our aim is that by 2010 no vulnerable household in the UK need risk ill-health due to a cold home.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: BNFL is an important employer and major exporter.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The government insists it maintains the highest health, safety and environmental standards.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are examining the scope for turning the company into a public-private partnership.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 4. Europe and the wider world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will be engaged and influential, fighting for the British national interest, as we set out in ‘Britain strong in the world’.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will support British Trade International, which gives business direct access to UK posts abroad, and maintain the UK’s position as the location of choice within Europe for multinational business.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s position on the single currency was set out by the Chancellor in October 1997 and reiterated by the Prime Minister in February 1999.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have made it clear that, provided the economic conditions are met, membership of a successful Euro would bring benefits to Britain in terms of jobs, investment and trade.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So, in principle, we are in favour of joining a successful single currency.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But, in practice, the five economic tests we have set out must be met before the government would recommend entry to the single currency.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: An assessment of the tests will be carried out early in the next Parliament.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: If the government and Parliament recommend entry, the British people will have the final say in a referendum.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So the choice is between a Conservative Party which will deny the people of Britain the chance to join, even if it is in our national interest to do so – and the Labour Party which says that, if it is in our national economic interest, the decision should be made by the British people in a referendum.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: No one left behind – Helping everyone become better off
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain is better off than in 1997 – but our ambition is to widen the winners’ circle so more people share in the benefits of economic growth.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In ‘A modern welfare state’ we set out the route to full employment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Fair and flexible work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are proud of our commitment to combine a dynamic economy with fair standards in the workplace.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour has put right historic wrongs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Every employee now has the right to four weeks’ paid holiday; trade unions have the right to recognition where a majority of the workforce want it; part-time workers have proper rights.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our objective has been to promote fairness consistent with the competitive position of British business.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That will continue to be our position.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have reformed the labour market to build a durable and fair basis for constructive employee relations.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: As we learn from the reforms, we will keep their effectiveness under review.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want to strengthen partnership at work, which can foster employee commitment and help at a time of industrial change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have established the Partnership Fund and want to expand it.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Information and consultation need to be appropriate to national traditions, with timely discussion of problems.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: When large-scale redundancies are being considered, there is an especially strong case for consultation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The government is reviewing the effectiveness of the UK’s current arrangements for information and consultation – works councils in larger firms operating across Europe as well as consultation on large-scale redundancies.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will implement the findings of our review in this area.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We support conciliation in the workplace to avoid resort to litigation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will examine reforms that promote efficiency and fairness.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Women still suffer an 18 per cent pay gap compared to men.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to tackling the causes of this inequality.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work with employers and employees to develop effective proposals, building on good practice and the sound business case, in both the private and public sectors.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will develop career services for all.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We aim for a ten per cent cut in death and major injuries at work by 2010 and will clarify responsibility, improve enforcement and toughen penalties for offences.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are also committed to working with managers and employees to reduce the problems of bullying and violence in the workplace.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: As a major employer, our ambition is to improve the quality of work for our employees – helping recruitment and retention.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Prosperity for every region.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Regions.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Balanced and sustainable growth depends on every region developing its capacity to the full.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Sitting back and leaving regional problems to the market is not acceptable.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The causes of disparities within and between regions must be addressed.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The new regional economic policy must be based on boosting regional capacity for innovation, enterprise and skill development, modernising regional infrastructure and improving university/industry links.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This is why Regional Development Agencies (RDAs) have been set up and why they now have extra money and new freedoms.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work in partnership with local people to ensure that all regions and communities build on their own strengths.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our task is to anticipate change, handle restructuring and enable businesses to move into high-skill, high value-added product markets.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s Job Transition Service will provide an intensive and personalised response to large-scale redundancies, helping people secure work or acquire new skills.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The JTS will focus its work on new Employment Action Plans drawn up by local economic partners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our commitment is to use the £1.2 billion rising to £1.7 billion a year now pledged to RDAs to promote business start-ups, strengthen links between business and universities, for example through university innovation centres and the establishment of a Centre for Manufacturing Excellence in every region to help firms develop.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: They will develop venture capital funds to boost wealth-creating capacity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Conservatives are so obsessed with the market and so out of touch with what goes on beyond Westminster that they even want to scrap RDAs – and with them the vital jobs, inward investment and prosperity that they bring.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Urban renewal.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Eighty per cent of people live in urban and inner-city Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are ambitious for Britain’s urban areas: we want to make them better places to live and better places to set up a business.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The New Deal for Communities, worth £1.9 billion over three years, and the £900 million Neighbourhood Renewal Fund (see ‘A modern welfare state’), as well as our reforms to local governance (see ‘Strong and safe communities’) will drive forward progress.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour offers £1 billion of tax cuts over the next five years to increase capital investment in urban areas, for new businesses and for new housing.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will reform the planning system to speed up decision-making, promote the most efficient use of land, and strike the right balance of environmental protection, safer communities and economic growth.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have put urban renewal at the heart of the planning system and set a target of 60 per cent of new house building to be on brownfield land or provided through the conversion of existing buildings.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Two Millennium Villages have set high standards in design.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will designate more in other parts of the country and continue to raise standards of urban design, with a quality mark to tackle cowboy builders.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Housing.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Lower interest rates enable more people to own their own homes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will make it easier for people buying and selling homes through a new sellers’ pack, through grants for low-income homeowners, and help for key workers in high-cost areas.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will honour our commitment to tackle homelessness.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to promote housing choice, with reforms to leasehold and commonhold law, a licensing scheme for houses in multiple occupation, and new powers for council tenants.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will develop a modern basis for land registration to make conveyancing faster and cheaper.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also examine the ways in which tenants can be helped to gain an equity stake in the value of their home.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to reducing by one third the backlog of sub-standard housing by 2004, with all social housing brought up to a decent standard by 2010.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will seek to reduce the use of costly bed-and-breakfast accommodation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We propose additional investment of £1.8 billion over the next three years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Some local authorities will continue to provide high-quality council housing.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are supporting the transfer of 200,000 dwellings per year, where tenants agree, to social landlords like housing associations, and new arms-length council housing companies.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also help 10,000 key workers buy their own homes in high-cost areas to tackle recruitment problems.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Rural Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The recent outbreak of foot and mouth disease has caused strain and distress in rural areas.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s priorities have been clear: to eradicate the disease as quickly and effectively as possible, to compensate those directly affected, and to protect the wider economy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: As the number of new cases falls significantly, and the clean-up of infected areas gathers pace, we are committed to help the most affected regions with a recovery plan including advice on sustainable restocking, organic conversion, and early retirement and outgoer schemes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will conduct a scientific review of how to prevent animal disease outbreaks from occurring in the future, and will introduce tough rules to back this up.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we must also learn some of the wider lessons.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Agriculture and fishing.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since the Second World War the economy of rural areas has undergone massive change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: About two per cent of the national workforce are now employed in agriculture.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But the industry is particularly important because of the links with food production, our landscape and our environment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s aim is to promote economic renewal with a sustainable future for farming, strengthened communities and sustainable land use.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Short-term pressures need to be met.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since the early 1990s, sectors of farming have been hard hit by BSE, the weakness of the Euro and falling world commodity prices.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour has provided £1.35 billion in short-term relief for farmers, including aid for diversification, farm business advice, better marketing, small slaughterhouses and restructuring of the industry.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have minimised many regulatory burdens and improved the way food safety, environmental and animal health regulations are implemented.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But British agriculture will only thrive in the longer term through a further, radical reorientation of the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP), away from distorting Europe-wide production subsidies towards more national responsibility for domestic farming, environmental and rural development priorities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: CAP reform is now more possible; Labour’s engagement with the EU gives us the best chance of making it happen.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have begun the process of change with our farming strategy and our seven-year, £3 billion Rural Development Plans for England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will expand this programme so farming can become more diverse and responsive to consumers, and produce in a way that sustains and improves the environment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have already increased payments for organic conversion from £0.5 million to £18 million, and will increase them further.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have set up an independent, open and consumer-focused Food Standards Agency to ensure that all food meets the highest standards.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will argue for the extension of food labelling, to give consumers more choice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Genetically modified (GM) foods and crops have caused concern despite stringent safety checks.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There should be high standards of safety – regulation must be strict, to protect the environment and promote public health and consumer choice – but we must use science to establish the facts, the opportunities and the risks before taking final decisions in an open way.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is also important to reform the Common Fisheries Policy to preserve fish stocks for the future.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In the short term, Labour is providing more than £60 million in structural funds over the next three years to help the industry, including a new decommissioning scheme while also tackling the problem of ‘quota-hoppers’.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Economic renewal.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The economic hub of a rural area is often a thriving market town.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That is why Labour is committing an extra £100 million of public and private funding over the next three years for the renewal of market towns.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: RDAs will be charged with renewal of rural as well as urban areas.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will support village life with rate relief for pubs, garages and shops, as well as farmers who diversify part of their activity into other enterprises.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Tourism is a vital, growing industry for Britain, with 1.8 million employees, and links to the museums, arts and heritage that people want to enjoy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Quality is our platform – which is why we now have a unified grading scheme for hotels and guest houses in England, and new training and New Deal opportunities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will support well-targeted promotion, regional programmes linked to RDAs, and high-quality information via the internet.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Traditional tourist resorts face special problems, so we have extended the assisted area map to include many seaside resorts and have negotiated an extension to the European Union regeneration funding so that seaside towns throughout the country can start rebuilding their economy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Rural life.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is pledged to a rural services standard to set out specifically what rural people can expect from 21 public service providers – with annual auditing and commitments to service improvement.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The rural school closure programme has been ended;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 3,000 new, affordable homes a year are on the way;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: a £30 million police programme will help cut rural crime;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: £239 million over three years has been set aside for rural transport services;
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: and the Post Office is now obliged to prevent closure of rural post offices except in unavoidable circumstances, with £270 million to help achieve this and recruit sub-postmasters.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is determined to protect Britain’s landscapes and wildlife.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Planning, transport and energy policy all make a difference.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have also designated the first new national parks since 1948 and brought consensus to a large increase in access to open countryside.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will press ahead with an £8 billion programme for water companies to clean up rivers and minimise damage from waste.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The dangers of coastal and inland flooding are now widely appreciated, and we are committed to investment in preventative solutions, including more sensitive use of agricultural land.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have increased the number of protected nature sites.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have also initiated important steps to improve animal welfare in Britain, and argued successfully for higher welfare standards for battery hens and pigs across the EU.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Leadership for the future.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to support our countryside and the people who live and work in it.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to create a new department to lead renewal in rural areas – a Department for Rural Affairs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Independent and wide-ranging views are essential to the development of strategic and long-term policy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will set up an independent commission to advise on how we create a sustainable, competitive and diverse farming and food sector within a thriving rural economy which advances environmental, health and animal welfare goals.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Coalfield communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to a ring-fenced £400 million package of help for Britain’s ex-mining communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This will support local regeneration, including support for new businesses.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will ensure that compensation due is paid quickly.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also honour our commitment to ex-miners suffering industrial diseases.
title: Ambitions for Britain
