text: We have set aside £4 billion to compensate those men who suffered from lung disease and vibration white finger after working in Britain’s mining industry and the widows who nursed them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain led the first industrial revolution.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Other countries got ahead in the second industrial revolution.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now our ambition is for Britain to succeed in the third industrial revolution – enhancing knowledge, speeding up communication and developing the talents of all the British people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: How Labour makes you better off:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by saving money on your mortgage, through economic stability and low interest rates
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by targeted tax cuts for families and pensioners
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by improving living standards through action to tackle Britain’s productivity gap
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by extending jobs and opportunity to every part of Britain, through regional support and a revitalised infrastructure
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by offering a minimum wage of £4.20 and an Employment Tax Credit
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 2. World-class public services
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goals:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - 50 per cent of young people entering higher education, as we raise standards in secondary schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Maximum waiting time of three months for any stage of treatment, as we become a healthier nation with fast, high-quality treatment free at the point of use.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our next steps:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Every secondary school with a distinct ethos, mission and centre of excellence
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Recruit an extra 10,000 teachers
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - More power to frontline staff with budgets for ward sisters and consultants and 75 per cent of NHS spending controlled by Primary Care Trusts.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - More health service workers – 20,000 more nurses, and at least 10,000 more GPs and consultants
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Free access to national museums and galleries
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The whole country depends on high-quality public services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have a ten-year vision for Britain’s public services: record improvement to match record investment, so they deliver high standards to all the people, all the time, wherever they live.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since 1997 there has been investment with reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Thanks to committed public servants, we have shown that rapid progress is possible and have begun to break the fatalism that says public services are always second class.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now is the time to move forward.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Economic stability makes more investment possible.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will put education and healthcare first.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We promise reform to match.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will decentralise power within a clear framework of national standards to increase the quality and diversity of public services and meet the challenge of rising expectations.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In education, we offer step-change in secondary schools to match the vast improvements in primary schools already achieved.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Every school will have a clear mission, with more teachers, new types of school, new opportunities for children and education tailored to fufil their potential.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2010, we want a majority of Britain’s young people entering higher education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In health, we will recruit 20,000 extra nurses and at least 10,000 extra doctors.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goal is a healthier nation, with fast, high-quality treatment meeting rising expectations and demographic and technological challenges.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Doctors and nurses will be in the driving seat of reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The job of government is also about ensuring that the enjoyment, excitement and inspiration of arts and sport come alive for everyone.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In all our public services, the key is to devolve and decentralise power to give freedom to frontline staff who perform well, and to change things where there are problems.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Services need to be highly responsive to the demands of users.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Where the quality is not improving quickly enough, alternative providers should be brought in.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Where private-sector providers can support public endeavour, we should use them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A ‘spirit of enterprise’ should apply as much to public service as to business.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s ambition for public services is simple: we want excellent services for all.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our challenge is to reverse decades of denigration and underinvestment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The citizen – the patient, the pupil, their needs and aspirations – must be central.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work with frontline staff to deliver a revival of our public services that is every bit as profound as the changes to the private sector in the 1980s.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In our first term, national action was vital – to tackle crises of funding and quality.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Government must take national responsibility for investment and for setting a clear national framework.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now we need to move on, empowering frontline staff.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Each service needs the right structure and incentives at local level – decentralisation of power with strong incentives for high performance.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Frontline staff are advocates for citizens, and ambassadors for their services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Motivated by an ethos of service, they must be supported to carry through change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Education – Labour’s number one priority
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Education remains Labour’s top priority.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Excellence for the many, not just the few is our driving passion.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our goal is to develop education to harness the individual talents of every pupil.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since 1997 rising standards have been achieved through major new investment and significant reforms: 17,000 schools have had vital repairs or refurbishment; 20,000 schools are now connected to the internet; there are nearly half a million fewer primary pupils in classes of more than 30; over 150,000 teachers are set to receive a £2,000 pay rise above the usual annual increase; every school is getting additional grants of up to £110,000 paid direct; and there are 11,000 more teachers and over 44,000 more support staff and classroom assistants.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our partnership with teachers has achieved what OfSTED calls a ‘transformation’ in primary school standards, thanks to smaller infant class sizes and major reform in the teaching of literacy and numeracy skills.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our task now is to achieve a similar transformation in secondary education, liberating the particular talent of every child.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our pledge to parents is clear: children should be on track to achieve their best, or receiving extra expert help to catch up.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Investment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Money alone cannot guarantee a good education, but extra investment is indispensable to achieving our ambitions.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We pledge a further step-change in investment in return for a further step-change in standards.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997 Labour promised to increase the share of national income devoted to education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Over this Parliament, we have increased it from 4.7 per cent to 5 per cent – £540 extra per pupil in real terms – and we are pledged to raise it to 5.3 per cent by 2003-04.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Investment in buildings and equipment has trebled.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: During the next Parliament, we will again increase the share of national income for education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Under-fives.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The early years of a child’s life are vital.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That is why we are doubling investment in early years education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There is now a free nursery place available for every four-year-old.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our new Foundation Stage provides a distinct phase of learning appropriate for the early years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2004 every three-year-old will be entitled to a free nursery place in the private, voluntary or statutory sector.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: OfSTED will help drive up standards.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Children with special educational needs will have those needs identified earlier.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to provide services which integrate early years education with childcare.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2004 we will have 100 Early Excellence Centres as beacons of good practice providing care and education for children from 0-5; we will set up 500 Sure Start Centres in disadvantaged areas to support children’s early development; and we will provide an extra 100,000 places offering wraparound care linked to early education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Primary schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Primary school teachers have achieved excellent results.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997 barely half of 11-yearolds were up to standard in English and maths tests.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The figures are now 75 per cent and 72 per cent respectively, well on the way to meeting our targets of 80 per cent in English and 75 per cent in maths by 2002.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The lowest-scoring Local Education Authorities (LEAs) are now achieving better results than the national average in 1996.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But Labour will not be satisfied until every child leaves primary school with the basic skills they need.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are setting targets for an 85 per cent success rate for 11-year-olds in English and maths, and will provide further intensive support for teachers to meet them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Primary education without the basics is a betrayal; but every parent rightly wants far more.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will provide primary pupils with wider opportunities to learn sports, musical instruments and a foreign language.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Secondary schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Transforming secondary education is the critical challenge of the next decade.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We reject a return to the 11-plus.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The principles of inclusion and equality of opportunity remain central to our commitment to liberate the potential of every child.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But, on their own, they are not enough to guarantee high standards.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Standards have risen in the past four years, particularly among pupils in less advantaged areas.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Strong school leadership and better teaching have turned around 700 failing schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But the challenge ahead is immense.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Too many pupils fall back and become disillusioned in the first two years of secondary school.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Just half of 16-year-olds currently gain good school-leaving qualifications, and levels of drop-out remain too high.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The dramatic advances at primary level mean pupils will increasingly arrive at secondary school demanding the best.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will radically modernise comprehensive schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In future every school must have:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The right leadership.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Headteachers must have the freedom and resources necessary to run their schools effectively.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have improved pay and training for headteachers and delegated more funding to schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Where they demonstrate success, we will further extend their freedom to manage their schools effectively.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will reduce the regulatory burden on all schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: High standards in the core curriculum
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will modernise the secondary curriculum to promote higher standards and better progression from school and college to university or work-based training.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: All pupils should reach the age of 14 fully competent in a broad range of subjects.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Effective teaching is the key.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will develop the literacy and numeracy strategies in secondary schools with the right balance of targets and flexibility, particularly for pupils not up to standard in the basics.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will set demanding targets for high achievement by the large majority of 14-year-old pupils in English, maths, science and IT tests – the passport to future success.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will promote more effective pathways beyond 14, including high-quality vocational routes that build on the new vocational GCSEs and A-levels.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will ensure there is an apprenticeship place for every young person who reaches the required standard.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A mission to achieve.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want every secondary school to develop a distinct ethos, mission and centre of excellence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Specialist schools offer the full national curriculum to the whole ability range while developing a centre of excellence – and their rates of improvement outstrip the national average.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Having trebled their number since 1997, we have pledged to expand their numbers to at least 1,500 by 2006, on the way to making specialist status available to all schools ready for it.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will encourage more church and other faith-sponsored schools, where parents wish it.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will establish more City Academies, and promote greater innovation in the supply of new schools with local consultation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will allow greater involvement in schools by outside organisations with a serious contribution to make to raising standards.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will extend provision for gifted children as we nurture children’s special talents.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: As part of our reform of the vital further education sector, we will encourage the development of free-standing sixth-form colleges.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Schools with sixth forms will be guaranteed their funding for pupils in real terms, provided numbers are maintained.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to expand Educational Maintenance Allowances so they cover 30 per cent of the country, and build upon them on the basis of the experience.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Pupils will be given greater opportunities through the promotion of partnerships between schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on the partnerships established between the state and private sectors.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Better infrastructure.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will invest nearly £8 billion in school buildings and equipment over the next three years, including the construction of 650 new or completely refurbished schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: IT has enormous potential to raise standards, and it is vital that every child leaves school able to make use of the new technologies.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Today, nearly all schools are connected to the internet.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to spend £1.8 billion over six years on equipping our schools for the information age.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will pioneer Curriculum Online to ensure materials are available to pupils in school and at home.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to continue to extend access to IT for pupils and teachers, including the possibility of a national leasing scheme to make top-quality hardware available at very low prices.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The right support.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Good schools also depend on parents and the local community.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to ensure that headteachers have the powers they need to tackle disruption and unacceptable behaviour in schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Local education authorities will focus on supporting school improvement, especially weak and failing schools, and delivering services that cannot be provided by individual schools.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will ensure better training and support for school governors.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Schools should be used more effectively as assets for the whole community, including for childcare and community learning.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will pilot ‘extended hours schools’ to develop this resource.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on the success of more than 40 study centres based in leading football clubs by extending community involvement to other sports.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Over time we want to develop safe places for children to play outside school hours and every pupil to have access to a summer school programme.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: An Academy for Talented Youth will be established in partnership with a leading university to pioneer summer and other dedicated provision for those with special talents.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have significantly improved support and provision for children with special needs or disabilities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: They should have access to the best possible education, with appropriate support, whether mainstream or special schooling most suits their needs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Schools in the toughest areas, and the teachers who work in them, need special support.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will expand the Excellence in Cities programme for urban secondary schools, with extra help for the weakest schools, learning mentors and in-school units to help manage pupil behaviour.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Where LEAs cannot effectively support school improvement, alternative provision will be made.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For schools facing exceptional pressures, for example very high pupil turnover, we will provide additional support, including significant reductions in the size of teaching groups where appropriate.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Teachers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Nothing in education is more important than having good teachers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have made teaching a far more attractive career, through better pay, better incentives to train including training salaries and loan write-offs, more recognition and improved support.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The General Teaching Council and National College for School Leadership are both now up and running.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want teaching to be a career of choice for the best graduates and attractive to people making career changes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to invest more in the profession and improve conditions for teachers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: High status, better salaries and proper professional support are all essential.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are conducting a strategic review of teacher workload and the right balance between teaching and administration, central direction and local discretion.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on its findings significantly to improve support for teachers in the classroom and in administrative tasks, so they can concentrate on their job.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • recruit 10,000 extra teachers and improve the adult:pupil ratio
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • support teachers in the classroom by employing more adults to help them
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • invest in rapid promotion and rewards for classroom excellence
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • boost recruitment and retention packages for teachers, particularly in high-cost areas and schools facing exceptional challenges
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • create new routes into teaching, including ‘train-to-teach’ courses accredited as part of undergraduate degrees and a stronger training mission for outstanding schools
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • further improve in-service training opportunities for teachers
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • develop school achievement awards that reward staff in 7,000 fast-improving schools a year
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • subsidise new PCs for teachers so that they have direct access to the latest technology.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Higher education – a world leader.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Higher education brings on average 20 per cent higher earnings and a 50 per cent lower chance of unemployment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is time for an historic commitment to open higher education to half of all young people before they are 30, combined with increased investment to maintain academic standards.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997 we inherited a system where the number of qualified people able to go to university was capped.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Today, the numbers are rising and universities have the funds to expand, with new two-year foundation degrees to offer students the option of a vocationally relevant, high-quality qualification as a way into skilled work or further study.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Over the next three years, we will continue to expand student numbers, taking us towards our 50 per cent target.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will maintain university entry standards while intensifying efforts to extend the huge advantages that a university education confers to able young people from all backgrounds.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: University summer schools, master classes and mentoring support will be offered to potential students from disadvantaged areas through a new Excellence Challenge programme, backed up by £190 million of funding.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will not introduce ‘top-up’ fees and have legislated to prevent them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since 1997 we have increased university funding by more than a billion pounds a year over the Parliament – and invested considerably more in research.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our new system of university finance ensures that 50 per cent of students pay no tuition fees at all, that no parents pay more than under the old system, and that students pay back loans progressively when they are earning.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will ensure that the funding system continues to promote access and excellence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will strengthen research and teaching excellence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is vital that our world-leading universities are able to compete with the best internationally.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also support world-class research and the development of public-private partnerships.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are determined to ensure that our universities have the freedom and incentives to meet our ambitions for them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Reforms to the inspection system for teaching will slash red tape for higher performing departments.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Health – Quality Services from a growing NHS
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For over 50 years the NHS has been part and parcel of what it means to be British.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: If you fall ill, the NHS is there.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Its foundations – tax-based funding and care according to need – remain as valid today as ever.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The NHS employs one million dedicated people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But it needs far-reaching reform to redesign its services around the needs of patients.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s ten-year NHS Plan is our strategy for ensuring fast, convenient, high-quality care in all parts of the country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will implement it through the next Parliament and, if elected, beyond.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Reform will be driven through primary care trusts (PCTs) as power and resources are decentralised to frontline staff.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997, waiting lists were at record levels and rising, hospital building had ground to a halt, and the number of nurses working in the NHS had fallen.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Today, waiting lists are down by over 100,000 and waiting times are falling.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There are 17,000 more nurses, over 6,500 more doctors, and over 9,000 more therapists, scientists and technicians working for patients.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The biggest-ever hospital building programme is under way.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: NHS Direct, the 24-hour nurse helpline, is available across the country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Eye tests for people who are 60 and over are now free.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But there is a lot more to do.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to investment and reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With Labour, in just four years the NHS will have grown by a third.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Spending on the health service is now rising by an average of over six per cent a year in real terms – the biggest sustained increase in its history and double that under the Conservatives.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Provided that as a country we maintain economic stability, we will, if elected, be able to sustain significant funding increases throughout the next Parliament.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So over time we will bring UK health spending up to the EU average.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The fundamentals of care.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That money will help us get the basics right.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2005 there will be 10,000 more doctors and 20,000 more nurses, with ward sisters in charge of ward budgets.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Matrons will make sure that hospital food is good and wards are clean, with power to stop payments to contractors who fail to keep hospitals up to scratch.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: ‘Nightingale’ wards for older people and mixed sex wards will be abolished, and mental health wards will be modernised.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There will be 7,000 extra beds in hospitals and in intermediate care.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And we will build 100 new hospital developments by 2010 and 500 one-stop primary care centres, with over 3,000 GP premises modernised by 2004.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are investing an extra £7 billion of capital investment into the health service.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have said that Private Finance Initiative (PFI) should not be delivered at the expense of the pay and conditions of the staff employed in these schemes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will seek ways in which, within the framework of PFI management, support staff could remain part of the NHS team.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Improving health.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our job is not just to improve the nation’s health service.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is to improve the nation’s health.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Deaths from cancer and heart disease are too high.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There has been a growing health gap between rich and poor.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Beyond other commitments to combat child poverty and poor housing, we will tackle the long-standing causes of ill-health and health inequality by:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • making the fight against cancer, heart disease and stroke the top priority for investment and reform, with earmarked extra funding of £1 billion by 2004.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The number of cardiologists will increase by around half and cancer specialists by nearly a third by 2005 compared to 1999- 2000.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Waiting times for cancer treatment will be cut.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ambition is to prevent 300,000 avoidable deaths over the next decade
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • tough targets to close the health gap to cut deaths in poorer communities and among poorer children improving mental health services, and a new emphasis on prevention, with more screening services including for conditions like sickle cell disease, cystic fibrosis and newborn hearing problems
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • offering the world’s best smoking cessation services to help the seven in ten smokers who say they want to give up
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • giving children aged four to six in nursery and primary schools a free piece of fruit every school day – the biggest boost to child nutrition since free school milk was introduced in 1946.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We remain committed to our bill – blocked by the Tories – to ban tobacco advertising and sponsorship.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Reforming the NHS
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The NHS has to earn the confidence of each new generation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It has to change the way it works if it is to meet today’s challenges and provide fast and modern services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With Labour, by 2004 Patients will be able to see a GP within 48 hours.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By the end of 2005 we will cut maximum waiting times for outpatient appointments from six months to three months, and for inpatients from 18 months to six months by expanding staff numbers and reforming how care is delivered.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Major conditions like cancer and heart disease will have priority, with all patients treated according to clinical urgency.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will give patients more choice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have restored the right of family doctors to refer patients to the hospital that is right for them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now we will redesign the system around the needs of patients.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Same day tests and diagnosis will become the norm.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By extending the use of NHS Direct and increasing the numbers of dentists, patients will get easier access to NHS dentistry wherever they live.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Specially built surgical units – managed by the NHS or the private sector – will guarantee shorter waiting times.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will use spare capacity in private-sector hospitals, treating NHS patients free of charge, where high standards and value for money are guaranteed.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It would be wrong to push people into paying for their operations.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That is why we reject the approach of the Conservatives, which would lead to this outcome.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By the end of 2005 every hospital appointment will be booked for the convenience of the patient, making it easier for patients and their GP to choose the hospital and consultant that best suits their needs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: From next year, if an operation is cancelled on the day of surgery for non-clinical reasons, the hospital will have to offer another binding date within 28 days, or fund the patient’s treatment at the time and hospital of the patient’s choice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By modernising all maternity units, increasing the number of midwives and giving women greater choice over childbirth, we will ensure that women receive the highest quality maternity care.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There will be tough new standards for care of children, the elderly and people with conditions like diabetes, kidney failure, multiple sclerosis, Parkinson’s disease and epilepsy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will further tackle the ‘lottery of care’ as we direct local health authorities and trusts to fund drugs and treatments recommended by the National Institute for Clinical Excellence (NICE).
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Genetic services will be extended in the NHS so that more patients enjoy the benefit of the latest advances in testing and treatment; but we will ban by law human cloning, and implement a moratorium on the use of genetic tests for insurance, following a recommendation of the Human Genetics Commission.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to examine demographic and technological challenges as they affect the NHS.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Patients will have more say, as in the NHS Plan.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will give every citizen a personal smartcard containing key medical data giving access to their medical records.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Older people, people with disabilities and their carers will be able to decide which services they want, with the choice of having cash given to them directly by local councils.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Patients will be represented on trust boards and have more information on local services’ quality.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Power devolved.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: To achieve this vision there will be clear national standards but greater decentralisation to frontline services and to the staff who run them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Locally agreed personal medical services schemes will be extended.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2004 all local healthcare will be organised by primary care trusts (PCTs) run by frontline doctors and nurses.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Together with the new care trusts, combining health and social services, PCTs will control 75 per cent of NHS funding.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With more power for PCTs we will cut the number of health authorities by two-thirds and devolve to the remainder the functions of NHS Regional Offices.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will use the savings of £100 million a year for investment in frontline services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Hospitals and other local services will have greater control over their own affairs and access to a £500 million performance fund, while consistently failing NHS hospitals will be taken over by successful NHS hospitals.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Appointments to trust boards will no longer be made by ministers but by an independent panel.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: NHS staff
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: None of these ambitions will be possible without major investment in the skill, working conditions and working practices of all NHS staff.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There will be extra pay too in high-cost areas, with pressure relieved through expanded staff numbers, reformed working practices and investment in training.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Every NHS employer will offer more flexible working hours for staff and especially nurses.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Childcare provision will be improved and we will offer targeted subsidies for childcare for NHS staff.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The pay system will be reformed to make it fairer.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: As set out in the NHS Plan, there will be new contracts for GPs and hospital consultants, coupled to extra money.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will examine the case for a public-private partnership with a commercial mortgage lender to make home ownership more affordable for nurses and other staff.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will set up a University of the NHS to guarantee to staff at all levels opportunities for training and career development.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Healthcare assistants, porters, cooks and cleaners will be offered an individual learning account worth £300 a year to develop their careers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will examine the potential for sabbaticals to help GPs, consultant nurses and consultants keep their skills up to date.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There will be new systems to learn from when things go wrong, a core education curriculum for all health professionals and reforms to modernise the way health professions are regulated.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will take action to protect NHS staff from violence and abuse, and reform the clinical negligence system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This is a vision worth fighting for.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It will take time to achieve, but this is the most comprehensive plan ever put before the British people to improve the state of the nation’s health and our health service.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It will deliver an NHS to be proud of.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Culture and sport
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The arts and sports are key to our quality of life.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: They matter for their own sake.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Millions make their living out of their creativity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Government can and must make sure the opportunities are there.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But, for the last 20 years, under-investment, misplaced priorities, and lack of organisation held back access and excellence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since 1997 this has begun to change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have started to invest and to reform the system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Investment in theatre develops the film and television stars of tomorrow; investment in sport will produce the Olympic and Paralympic medal winners of 2012.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Culture and sport should not be seen as peripheral issues – they are vital to our identity and enjoyment as a country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are pledged to the investment necessary to expand access and excellence together in culture and sport, building on excellence in film and broadcasting.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Sport.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The performance of British athletes at the Sydney Olympics and Paralympics thrilled everyone.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to a radical extension of sporting opportunities and facilities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Sport is a good health policy, a good crime reduction policy, a good way of building communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We pledge a sports entitlement for all children, giving them access to at least two hours a week of sport in or after school.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Thanks to our ban on the enforced sale of playing fields and a commitment of nearly £1 billion to new sports facilities and 1,000 school sports co-ordinators, all children will be offered coaching and competitive games.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Children with talent need more investment: we have pledged to fund 200 specialist sports colleges.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will maintain the elite funding we put in place for individual athletics, with a first-class athletics stadium for the World Athletics Championships in 2005 and a new stadium in Manchester for next year’s Commonwealth Games.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to sell the Tote to a racing trust to allow it to compete commercially, with all long-term profits invested in the sport.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to finding ways to support the amateur sports clubs to which 5.6 million people now belong.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The House of Commons elected in 1997 made clear its wish to ban fox-hunting.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The House of Lords took a different view (and reform has been blocked).
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Such issues are rightly a matter for a free vote and we will give the new House of Commons an early opportunity to express its view.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will then enable Parliament to reach a conclusion on this issue.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: If the issue continues to be blocked we will look at how the disagreement can be resolved.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have no intention whatsoever of placing restrictions on the sports of angling and shooting.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Arts.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Thirty million people enjoy arts activities each year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The arts are crucial to national life, with a huge importance for the creative and tourist industries.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Yet the Conservatives introduced charges for our national museums and galleries, cut the arts budget, and reduced support for arts education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since 1997 that has changed.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: National museums are already free for children and pensioners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to reform the VAT system to ensure they will be made free for everyone from December.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2004, arts funding will be 60 per cent above its 1997 level in real terms.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: An extra £25 million a year will go to regional theatre, increasing the number and quality of productions for audiences in England.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have invested in our orchestras, and put an extra £10 million a year into developing our regional museums and galleries.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have maintained our commitment to the nation’s heritage and to its historic buildings, and we will continue our drive to put architectural quality at the heart of the design of new public buildings.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Education is the bedrock of an artistic society.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are once again giving children the opportunity to learn music, and we will ensure the opportunity is available to all.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New creative partnerships – linking schools with artists and arts organisations particularly in disadvantaged areas – will offer children the chance to develop artistic and creative talents.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on the pilot projects.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have made the largest-ever investment in computerising libraries; all will be on-line by 2002, with guaranteed standards to meet users’ needs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: From 2002, Culture On-line will offer children and adults alike tailored access to our national collections and cultural activity over the internet.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will create new specialist arts schools and city academies to offer specialist education to the most talented young people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Public money devoted to the arts should be spent on excellent art, not bureaucracy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Arts Council is undergoing substantial reform – creating a simpler structure which gives more power to the regions, cuts bureaucratic costs further, and which can deliver a better service to individual artists and arts organisations.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will ensure that our arts funding system backs excellence, giving artists and arts organisations the long-term stability they need to become world leaders.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Creative industries.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The creative industries are a vital engine of our economy, providing jobs for over one million people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The National Endowment for Science, Technology and the Arts (NESTA) has been set up to back our most talented young people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Creative entrepreneurs need seed funding, cheap accommodation near other similar companies, and advice on how to develop their talent into a business.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: To meet those needs, we now plan to provide start-up advice, services and funding for new businesses.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Venture capital will be available through RDAs, and a creative industries champion will be appointed in every Business Link.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Lottery.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Under the Conservatives, many communities missed out on their fair share of lottery money.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The number of grants to community groups has trebled with Labour.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Yet there are still communities which have received a disproportionately small share of lottery funding.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will ensure a fairer deal for them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour has reshaped the lottery to match people’s priorities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Money goes for revenue as well as capital.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The New Opportunities Fund (NOF) directs help to education, health and the environment – after-school clubs, vital cancerbeating equipment, local green spaces.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We backed going ahead with the Dome as an opportunity to showcase British talent and give people a good day out in millennium year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Despite being enjoyed by more than six million visitors, the Dome did not fulfil expectations and we have learned the lessons, good and bad, from it.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But the development of the Dome has been the catalyst for unlocking the value of the North Greenwich peninsula and regenerating local communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We need a revolution in the status, standards and focus of our public services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is prepared to make the investment in staff and services – and we are ready to match investment with reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: How Labour helps young people:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by raising standards and investing more in education, from nursery schools to adult learning
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by giving the majority of young adults the opportunity to study in higher education
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by tackling youth unemployment, with the New Deal made permanent
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by opportunities to train as you work, through modern apprenticeships and the right to time off to study
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by expanding sports facilities and schools and in the community
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by cleaning up the environment, with support for green technologies and global action to tackle climate change
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 3. A modern welfare state
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goals
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Sustain a higher percentage of people in work than ever before, as we seek full employment in every region.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Child poverty halved and pensioner poverty tackled, as we extend opportunity for all children and security for all pensioners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our next steps:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - An ‘Employment First’ interview for everyone coming on to benefits.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Expanded support for children through tax and benefit reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Extend and increase paid maternity leave and introduce paid paternity leave.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - New pension credit for lower- and middle-income pensioners, and the Winter Fuel Payment retained.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - £900 million Neighbourhood Renewal Fund for jobs, education and crime Prevention.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: As society changes, so the welfare state must change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have a ten-year vision for an active welfare state: to promote work for those who can, security for those who cannot, and rewards for those who save, volunteer, learn or train.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Since 1997, we have cut the costs of unemployment, saving £4 billion last year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: As a result, we have been able to spend more on tackling poverty and raising family support within a social security budget that has grown, in Labour’s first term, at the lowest rate since 1948.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Employment is not just the foundation of affordable welfare, it is the best anti-poverty, anti-crime and pro-family policy yet invented.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: After years of mass unemployment, full employment is now on the agenda.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goal is to sustain a higher percentage of people in work than ever before.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With more than one million more people in work than in 1997, and a million vacancies in the economy, we need to extend the New Deal, not abolish it as the Conservatives propose.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We judge our society by how we treat the young and the old.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In this Parliament, over one million children have been taken out of poverty; our ten-year goal is to halve child poverty, ending it in a generation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will transform support for children to achieve it.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For those in retirement, security depends on partnership between state and funded provision.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We promise that, within two years, no pensioner need live on less than £100 per week, increased annually in line with earnings growth.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: On top of that, we will reward pensioners who save.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Government cannot achieve social inclusion for people, but it can help them achieve it for themselves, by transferring power and opportunity to local communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That is our promise.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Full employment – Labour’s goal
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With Labour, the welfare state helps people into work, makes work pay, supports them at work, and demands responsibilities in return.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ambition is full employment in every region – good for the economy and good for social justice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The New Deal has already helped to cut longterm youth unemployment by 75 per cent – 280,000 young people have been helped into work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Long-term unemployment is down by over 60 per cent.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The claimant count is the lowest for 25 years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But too many people are still denied the opportunity to work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A million people remain unemployed; 100,000 lone parents have come off income support since 1997, but our target is to raise the current 50 per cent employment rate to 70 per cent.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Many people with disabilities out of work say they would like to work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Older people, with a wealth of talent and experience, are a resource we cannot afford to waste.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour has ended the days of low-grade job schemes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The New Deal leads to real jobs, a lower benefits bill and higher tax receipts.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We now need to build on its success, extending it to more people across the country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We also need to ensure that the barriers to work are pulled down by delivering on our obligation to tackle discrimination so that all people can make the most of their talents.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Making the New Deal a permanent deal
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The benefits system we inherited was fragmented, complex and contradictory.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are putting in place clear, consistent rules: those who can work should be in work or in contact with the labour market.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: As unemployment falls, we need further reform to help people into work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will introduce a new principle of ‘employment first’, with rights and responsibilities balanced at every stage.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The contract is simple: quality opportunities for real responsibility.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: ‘Something for something’ is the foundation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is pledged to create a new Working Age Agency, JobCentre Plus, merging the old Employment Service and Benefits Agency, and focusing on the key skill needs of areas of the country and sectors of the economy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Whoever you are, wherever you live, you will get the opportunities suited to your needs – from one office, one adviser, one system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The New Deals for young people and older workers will focus on numeracy, literacy, IT skills and presentation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Where people are homeless or suffer drug or mental health problems we will offer specialist support.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: More than 140,000 adults aged over 25 have been unemployed for over 18 months.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will deliver more intensive and flexible help, with increased responsibilities for claimants.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will offer greater flexibility to personal advisers and encourage greater engagement of employers, with IT training for all New Dealers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Employment Zones include funding geared to results and public-private partnership.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: On the basis of the evidence we will consider their extension to new areas and new claimant groups.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on the Action Teams for Jobs model, which is targeting 40 of the most severely disadvantaged areas, to tackle the employment gap for ethnic minorities, and devote £45 million to provide stepping stones into employment for the hardest to employ.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: All lone parents will be invited to employment interviews to help them seek employment opportunities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on the lessons of the Choices programme, which offers help with learning, work and childcare.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Partners of unemployed people with children, like those without children, will also be asked to interviews to discuss their options.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Parents need good-quality and affordable childcare if they are to have real choice about work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For the first time, Britain has a National Childcare Strategy – covering cost, provision and quality.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have already created 300,000 extra childcare places.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2004 our target is to have childcare places for 1.6 million children.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our vision is ambitious: safe and reliable childcare nationwide, allowing all parents to combine home and work, confident in the childcare they have chosen.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will help with the costs of childcare through the Childcare Tax Credit – and will look to extend it to people looking after children with disabilities, and shift workers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will support the commitment of community and voluntary groups to build up a diverse range of childcare – from Early Excellence Centres to neighbourhood nurseries and informal care (see ‘World-class public services’).
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Many older workers now want to continue in work full- or part-time.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Yet one in three people between 50 and state pension age is not working.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: To help them we will build on the New Deal 50+.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: To help bridge the divide between work and retirement, we will examine ways to ensure that people will be able to draw on their occupational pension and continue to work parttime for the same employer, phasing their retirement without compromising their pension.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are exploring how to facilitate the transition from work to positive voluntary activity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ambition of full employment is part of a deal: if you put in a fair day’s work, the government will ensure you are able to support yourself and your family.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The minimum wage is the foundation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we offer a guarantee of take-home pay too.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For people with families, we promise to match your effort with support through the tax system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For those on low incomes without children we will create an Employment Tax Credit to boost their earnings, tackle poverty and improve work incentives.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: People with disabilities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ambition is to enable people with disabilities to play a full part in the community.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Disability Rights Commission now ensures full civil rights for people with disabilities; we have legislated so those with special needs or disabilities have equal access to education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are now committed to extending basic rights and opportunities, as indicated in our response to the Disability Rights Taskforce.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are requiring different kinds of public transport to be made accessible, and introducing concessionary bus fares for the first time, for people with disabilities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The New Deal for Disabled People pioneers new ways of helping people with disabilities into jobs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The opportunity to work is vital to civil rights; we are testing how best to offer help with rehabilitation and job retention.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will invest an additional £40 million to help people with disabilities into work, ensure that it is worthwhile to try out a job and stay in work if they have high care costs, and improve assessment for equipment and services as people move in and out of work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will not use disability benefits to disguise unemployment – the Tory approach in the 1980s.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The number of people getting Incapacity Benefit (IB) has fallen by 11 per cent since 1997; but too many people are written off when in fact they could, with support, work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will help break down the barriers that keep people with disabilities out of work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to modernise the operation of the benefits system so that, if people can work, we help them to do so, and stop them slipping from lack of work to inability to work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Around 18 million working days are lost each year due to work-related illness – at a cost of over £17 billion.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Many people on Industrial Injuries Benefit are helped into work by combining support with effective services, and we want to help as many of the rest as possible.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But if people cannot work society has a duty to provide security for them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For people unable to take up paid work, we are committed to offer security.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have increased support for children with parents on income support by 80 per cent in real terms since 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There is now a minimum income guarantee of £142 per week for people with disabilities under 60.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Incapacity Benefit has been extended to people disabled from a young age.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Disability Living Allowance has been extended to three- and four-year-olds.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to keep the system under review.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Housing benefit.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Although the number of people claiming housing benefit is currently falling, it remains the main way in which accommodation is made affordable.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our first priority has been to work with local authorities to drive up administrative standards and tackle fraud and error.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we must continue to reform it.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So we will simplify housing benefit and its administration, distinguishing between people of working age and pensioners, reforming provision for private tenants, and examining the case for longer awards.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will spread best practice in administration.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In the longer term, we will build on our restructuring of rents to ensure that for people of working age, housing benefit as well as the Working Families Tax Credit strengthen work incentives.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Children and Families
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Strong and stable family life offers the best possible start to children.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And marriage provides a strong foundation for stable relationships.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The government supports marriage.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But it has to do more than that.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It must support families, above all families with children.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our vision of the tax and benefits system for families with children is to provide help for all families; to give most help at the time families need it most; and to give more help to those families most in need.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Conservatives stacked the tax system against families: over four million children lived in poverty; one in five children were growing up in households without work; the average income of households with children had fallen to 30 per cent below the level for those without children.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour has started to turn this round.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have raised child benefit for the first child by over a quarter.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Working Families Tax Credit has meant a tax cut averaging £31 per week for 1.1 million families.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 2001-02, an average of nearly £500 above 1997-98 levels will be invested in every child in Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Personal tax and benefit changes have made families with children an average of £1,000 a year better off.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are pledged to go further – to eradicate child poverty in a generation and halve it by 2010.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In the next Parliament we will make major changes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Children’s Tax Credit – the family tax cut – is worth up to £520 a year for five million families, with half a million families removed from paying tax altogether.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is paid until one parent earns more than £40,000 per year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: From 2003, the Integrated Child Credit will bring together all existing income-related payments for children, providing most help to the neediest children, building on the foundation of universal child benefit.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With the new system of child support, every family will receive at least £15 per week, and those most in need £50 per week – over £2,500 per year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For the first time, Britain will have a seamless system of child support, whether parents are in or out of work, paid to the main carer.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our aim is to make the goal of ending child poverty in Britain a political litmus test for any political party running for office.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The task for the next Parliament is to help another million children out of poverty.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Assets.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our active welfare state has so far been based on work, finance and services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is now time to add a fourth pillar to the welfare state – a programme to extend to all children the advantages that come from reaching adulthood backed by a financial nest-egg.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Nearly a third of individuals have no financial savings or assets at all.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: People without assets are much more likely to have lower earnings and higher unemployment, and are less likely to start a business or enter higher education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The government already encourages people to save for a rainy day and save for a pension.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are determined to extend the savings habit to more people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we are pledged also to use saving to promote opportunity for the next generation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: All newly born children will have an interestbearing Child Trust Fund set up in their name with an initial endowment from the government, with more for poorer children.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The endowment will be locked until the child reaches adulthood.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will provide incentives for extended family and friends as well as parents to contribute to the fund.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: All the next generation will have the backing of a real financial asset to invest in learning, buying a home or setting up a business.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Caring for children.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A safe childhood is not just about financial security.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is also about care for children, especially the 58,000 children in care.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Society is failing these children: 70 per cent leave school without any GCSEs and too many have been abused while in care.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour supports a national children’s rights director to act as a champion for children in need and we will consult on whether to develop and extend the director’s role.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Criminal Records Bureau will help stop paedophiles and others who are a danger to children from working with them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: From next year, all children’s homes will, for the first time, be subject to independent spot checks.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The level of educational attainment of children in care will be significantly increased.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Every child leaving care will be guaranteed access to a job, training or education.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For many children in care, adoption offers the best chance of success in life.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will make adoption faster and fairer.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Children who need new families will be placed within 12 months by 2004.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We aim to ensure that at least 1,000 more children a year are adopted, with improved post-adoption support for parents.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Family-friendly working.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For the majority of parents, time is precious.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Many employers offer excellent schemes for family-friendly working.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we want to go further – with government funding to help parents devote more time to their children early in life.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want government to promote choice because, without our help, many people are denied the choices that should be theirs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A flexible labour market must work to the benefit of both employers and employees.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Statutory maternity leave is currently 18 weeks; we propose to increase it to six months.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Statutory maternity pay is paid at a flat rate of £60 a week; we propose to increase it to £100 per week, as big an increase in the next two years as in the past 40 years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Fathers currently have no legal right to paid time off on the birth of a child; we propose to introduce it for two weeks, also paid at £100 per week.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We need to do more to help parents balance work and family.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Many parents, especially mothers, want to work reduced hours when they do go back to work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work with business and employees to combine flexible working with the needs of business.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Child Support Agency.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Some families break up.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Government’s role is to ensure that both parents retain responsibility for the financial support of their children where they are able to do so.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have always supported the principle underlying the work of the Child Support Agency (CSA), but the Conservatives bungled its introduction.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That is why we have already legislated to reform the CSA and these improvements will come on stream from 2002.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A simple system will ensure a better deal for children, that fathers pay a fair share, that mothers benefit from their doing so, and that tougher action is taken against parents who do not comply.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Pensions and Pensioners
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997 Labour made a clear commitment to ensure pensioners share fairly in the rising prosperity of the nation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: At this election, we repeat our commitment to pensioners – we honour your lifetime of work by ensuring that you share fairly in the nation’s rising prosperity, and are committed to tackling pensioner poverty.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build a secure system on the foundation of the basic state pension.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: As a result of Labour’s policies, in this Parliament spending on pensioners will be £4.5 billion a year more in real terms than in 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Of this, £2 billion is going to the poorest third of pensioners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our first priority was to help those on lowest incomes: we have lifted the incomes of the 1.7 million poorest pensioners by at least £800 a year, and for some couples by up to £1,400.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Pensioner households are on average £11 per week better off than they were in 1997; and over three million pensioner households benefit from free TV licences for those over-75s.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The pensioners tax allowance means six out of ten pensioners pay no tax.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have halved the rate of tax they pay on savings income.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have pledged to extend tax allowances further so that by 2003 no pensioner pays tax until their income reaches £127 per week.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We now need to go further.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With Labour, the basic state pension will rise by 2003 to £77 a week for a single pensioner and £123 a week for a pensioner couple.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We guarantee that the Minimum Income Guarantee will be uprated each year in line with earnings, throughout the next Parliament.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 2003, this will mean no single pensioner will have an income below £100 per week and no pensioner couple an income below £154 per week.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour introduced the Winter Fuel Payment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Its level is set each year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Last winter it was raised to £200.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For next winter it will also be £200.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also do more to reward pensioners who have saved.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Pensioners who work and save will find, for the first time ever, the government rewarding their saving.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Pensioner couples with an income up to £200 per week and single pensioners with income up to £135 per week will be rewarded for saving – the government adding up to 60p for each £1 of savings income up to a maximum of £23.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In the process, we will abolish the weekly means test for pensioners, along with removing the unfair test of savings, which penalises pensioners who have modest savings and whose thrift should be recognised.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is also vital to have in place long-term pension reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We support a fair balance of public and private provision.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Occupational and personal pensions, properly regulated, will continue to offer security for middle and high earners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue discussions on annuity reform to ensure tax rules do not unnecessarily restrict the development of annuity products and markets.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For low- to middle-income earners, stakeholder pensions cap costs, guarantee value for money, offer flexibility, and drive down fees across the board.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And for the lowest paid and carers, full-time parents and people with disabilities, the state second pension will top up their pension contributions to give a decent pension in retirement to 18 million people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Today’s pensioners have much to give to society.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s NHS Plan offers £1. 4 billion of investment for older people to promote better health and support independence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Pensioners also need simple, accessible services that treat them with dignity and promote independence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on Care Direct to provide a better integration of health, housing, benefits and social care for older people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This will be an integrated ‘third age service’ to help older people and those who care for them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Carers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Not only are the large majority of people who require care older, but also the majority of carers are older people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will tackle the problems faced by people requiring care and the problems of carers themselves.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The national carers strategy is the first step, with information, support and care for carers: Labour will spend £500 million over the next three years providing financial support for 300,000 carers through the benefits system, and £255 million for social care services for carers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: More is being done for carers through income support; carers will be better able to combine work and care; and 75,000 more carers each year are now able to take a break from their caring responsibilites.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are proud that, with Labour, care by qualified nurses will be made free to all, wherever it is received.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: One hundred and fifty thousand more older people will receive rehabilitation and convalescence through growing investment in the NHS and social services that the Tories refuse to match.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want to see carers given access to the cash and services appropriate to their service to their relatives and the community.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Carers and Disabled Children’s Act gives carers a right to an independent assessment of their needs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will examine the development of a fund to help local authorities produce tailored care packages to back up the results of these assessments.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Social inclusion
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Social exclusion, affecting around ten per cent of the population, living in fewer than 1,000 of the most deprived wards in Britain, damages lives and wrecks communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Before 1997, social exclusion was ignored.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now we have a new approach – improving the quality of mainstream services, preventing people falling between the cracks, and reintegrating them into society if things go wrong.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have targeted five priorities:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Homelessness
title: Ambitions for Britain
